item.title: Cloudflare with LetsEncrypt SSL Certificates + Apache's ProxyPass
item.description: So, you want to use LetsEncrypt to generate a free SSL certificate for your site behind Cloudflare and Apache (acting as a ReverseProxy). After many hours of research and tweaking, I got this setup to work. Here I will document my process for you to use. In the end, your setup will look something like this: User <-(SSL)-> Cloudflare <-(SSL)-> Apache <–> Your Webapp (not SSL). This guide assumes you have a site already setup without SSL.
